<Link id="l00038" /><CodeLine lineNumber="38"><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">class </span><span class="doxyHighlight"><a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/targetlibraryinfo">TargetLibraryInfo</a>;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00039" /><CodeLine lineNumber="39"><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">class </span><span class="doxyHighlight"><a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/value">Value</a>;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00040" /><CodeLine lineNumber="40"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00041" /><CodeLine lineNumber="41"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// Analysis providing branch probability information.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00042" /><CodeLine lineNumber="42"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00043" /><CodeLine lineNumber="43"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// This is a function analysis which provides information on the relative</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00044" /><CodeLine lineNumber="44"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// probabilities of each &quot;edge&quot; in the function&#39;s CFG where such an edge is</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00045" /><CodeLine lineNumber="45"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// defined by a pair (PredBlock and an index in the successors). The</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00046" /><CodeLine lineNumber="46"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// probability of an edge from one block is always relative to the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00047" /><CodeLine lineNumber="47"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// probabilities of other edges from the block. The probabilites of all edges</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00048" /><CodeLine lineNumber="48"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// from a block sum to exactly one (100%).</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00049" /><CodeLine lineNumber="49"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// We use a pair (PredBlock and an index in the successors) to uniquely</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00050" /><CodeLine lineNumber="50"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// identify an edge, since we can have multiple edges from Src to Dst.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00051" /><CodeLine lineNumber="51"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// As an example, we can have a switch which jumps to Dst with value 0 and</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00052" /><CodeLine lineNumber="52"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// value 10</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00053" /><CodeLine lineNumber="53"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00054" /><CodeLine lineNumber="54"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// Process of computing branch probabilities can be logically viewed as three</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00055" /><CodeLine lineNumber="55"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// step process:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00056" /><CodeLine lineNumber="56"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00057" /><CodeLine lineNumber="57"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///   First, if there is a profile information associated with the branch then</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00058" /><CodeLine lineNumber="58"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// it is trivially translated to branch probabilities. There is one exception</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00059" /><CodeLine lineNumber="59"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// from this rule though. Probabilities for edges leading to &quot;unreachable&quot;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00060" /><CodeLine lineNumber="60"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// blocks (blocks with the estimated weight not greater than</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00061" /><CodeLine lineNumber="61"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// UNREACHABLE&#95;WEIGHT) are evaluated according to static estimation and</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00062" /><CodeLine lineNumber="62"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// override profile information. If no branch probabilities were calculated</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00063" /><CodeLine lineNumber="63"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// on this step then take the next one.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00064" /><CodeLine lineNumber="64"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00065" /><CodeLine lineNumber="65"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///   Second, estimate absolute execution weights for each block based on</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00066" /><CodeLine lineNumber="66"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// statically known information. Roots of such information are &quot;cold&quot;,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00067" /><CodeLine lineNumber="67"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// &quot;unreachable&quot;, &quot;noreturn&quot; and &quot;unwind&quot; blocks. Those blocks get their</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00068" /><CodeLine lineNumber="68"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// weights set to BlockExecWeight::COLD, BlockExecWeight::UNREACHABLE,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00069" /><CodeLine lineNumber="69"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// BlockExecWeight::NORETURN and BlockExecWeight::UNWIND respectively. Then the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00070" /><CodeLine lineNumber="70"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// weights are propagated to the other blocks up the domination line. In</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00071" /><CodeLine lineNumber="71"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// addition, if all successors have estimated weights set then maximum of these</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00072" /><CodeLine lineNumber="72"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// weights assigned to the block itself (while this is not ideal heuristic in</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00073" /><CodeLine lineNumber="73"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// theory it&#39;s simple and works reasonably well in most cases) and the process</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00074" /><CodeLine lineNumber="74"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// repeats. Once the process of weights propagation converges branch</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00075" /><CodeLine lineNumber="75"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// probabilities are set for all such branches that have at least one successor</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00076" /><CodeLine lineNumber="76"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// with the weight set. Default execution weight (BlockExecWeight::DEFAULT) is</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00077" /><CodeLine lineNumber="77"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// used for any successors which doesn&#39;t have its weight set. For loop back</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00078" /><CodeLine lineNumber="78"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// branches we use their weights scaled by loop trip count equal to</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00079" /><CodeLine lineNumber="79"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// &#39;LBH&#95;TAKEN&#95;WEIGHT/LBH&#95;NOTTAKEN&#95;WEIGHT&#39;.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00080" /><CodeLine lineNumber="80"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00081" /><CodeLine lineNumber="81"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// Here is a simple example demonstrating how the described algorithm works.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00082" /><CodeLine lineNumber="82"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00083" /><CodeLine lineNumber="83"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///          BB1</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00084" /><CodeLine lineNumber="84"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///         /   \\</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00085" /><CodeLine lineNumber="85"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///        v     v</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00086" /><CodeLine lineNumber="86"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///      BB2     BB3</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00087" /><CodeLine lineNumber="87"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///     /   \\</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00088" /><CodeLine lineNumber="88"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///    v     v</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00089" /><CodeLine lineNumber="89"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///  ColdBB  UnreachBB</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00090" /><CodeLine lineNumber="90"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00091" /><CodeLine lineNumber="91"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// Initially, ColdBB is associated with COLD&#95;WEIGHT and UnreachBB with</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00092" /><CodeLine lineNumber="92"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// UNREACHABLE&#95;WEIGHT. COLD&#95;WEIGHT is set to BB2 as maximum between its</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00093" /><CodeLine lineNumber="93"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// successors. BB1 and BB3 has no explicit estimated weights and assumed to</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00094" /><CodeLine lineNumber="94"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// have DEFAULT&#95;WEIGHT. Based on assigned weights branches will have the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00095" /><CodeLine lineNumber="95"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// following probabilities:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00096" /><CodeLine lineNumber="96"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// P(BB1-&gt;BB2) = COLD&#95;WEIGHT/(COLD&#95;WEIGHT + DEFAULT&#95;WEIGHT) =</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00097" /><CodeLine lineNumber="97"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///   65535 / (0xffff + 0xfffff) = 0.0588(5.9%)</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00098" /><CodeLine lineNumber="98"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// P(BB1-&gt;BB3) = DEFAULT&#95;WEIGHT&#95;WEIGHT/(COLD&#95;WEIGHT + DEFAULT&#95;WEIGHT) =</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00099" /><CodeLine lineNumber="99"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///          1048575 / (0xffff + 0xfffff) = 0.941(94.1%)</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00100" /><CodeLine lineNumber="100"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// P(BB2-&gt;ColdBB) = COLD&#95;WEIGHT/(COLD&#95;WEIGHT + UNREACHABLE&#95;WEIGHT) = 1(100%)</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00101" /><CodeLine lineNumber="101"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// P(BB2-&gt;UnreachBB) =</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00102" /><CodeLine lineNumber="102"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///   UNREACHABLE&#95;WEIGHT/(COLD&#95;WEIGHT+UNREACHABLE&#95;WEIGHT) = 0(0%)</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00103" /><CodeLine lineNumber="103"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00104" /><CodeLine lineNumber="104"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// If no branch probabilities were calculated on this step then take the next</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00105" /><CodeLine lineNumber="105"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// one.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00106" /><CodeLine lineNumber="106"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00107" /><CodeLine lineNumber="107"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///   Third, apply different kinds of local heuristics for each individual</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00108" /><CodeLine lineNumber="108"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// branch until first match. For example probability of a pointer to be null is</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00109" /><CodeLine lineNumber="109"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// estimated as PH&#95;TAKEN&#95;WEIGHT/(PH&#95;TAKEN&#95;WEIGHT + PH&#95;NONTAKEN&#95;WEIGHT). If</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00110" /><CodeLine lineNumber="110"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// no local heuristic has been matched then branch is left with no explicit</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00111" /><CodeLine lineNumber="111"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// probability set and assumed to have default probability.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00112" /><CodeLine lineNumber="112" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/branchprobabilityinfo"><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">class </span><span class="doxyHighlight"><a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/branchprobabilityinfo/#a771cb111ac312594590e53c1f3699fda">BranchProbabilityInfo</a> &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00113" /><CodeLine lineNumber="113"><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">public</span><span class="doxyHighlight">:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00114" /><CodeLine lineNumber="114" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/branchprobabilityinfo/#a771cb111ac312594590e53c1f3699fda"><span class="doxyHighlight">  <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/branchprobabilityinfo/#a771cb111ac312594590e53c1f3699fda">BranchProbabilityInfo</a>() = </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">default</span><span class="doxyHighlight">;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00115" /><CodeLine lineNumber="115"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00116" /><CodeLine lineNumber="116" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/branchprobabilityinfo/#ad18bab54d5bb7925300874713924714b"><span class="doxyHighlight">  <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/branchprobabilityinfo/#ad18bab54d5bb7925300874713924714b">BranchProbabilityInfo</a>(</span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">const</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/function">Function</a> &amp;<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/md5-cpp/#a96d73bbd7af15cb1fc38c3f4a3bd82e9">F</a>, </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">const</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/loopinfo">LoopInfo</a> &amp;LI,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00117" /><CodeLine lineNumber="117"><span class="doxyHighlight">                        </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">const</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/targetlibraryinfo">TargetLibraryInfo</a> &#42;TLI = </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">nullptr</span><span class="doxyHighlight">,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00118" /><CodeLine lineNumber="118"><span class="doxyHighlight">                        <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/dominatortree">DominatorTree</a> &#42;DT = </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">nullptr</span><span class="doxyHighlight">,</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00213" /><CodeLine lineNumber="213"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Data structure to track SCCs for handling irreducible loops.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00214" /><CodeLine lineNumber="214" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/branchprobabilityinfo/sccinfo"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">class </span><span class="doxyHighlight"><a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/branchprobabilityinfo/sccinfo/#adb1204788a33211be05a6a01356e78d0">SccInfo</a> &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00215" /><CodeLine lineNumber="215"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Enum of types to classify basic blocks in SCC. Basic block belonging to</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00216" /><CodeLine lineNumber="216"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// SCC is &#39;Inner&#39; until it is either &#39;Header&#39; or &#39;Exiting&#39;. Note that a</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00217" /><CodeLine lineNumber="217"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// basic block can be &#39;Header&#39; and &#39;Exiting&#39; at the same time.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00218" /><CodeLine lineNumber="218"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">enum</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> SccBlockType &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00219" /><CodeLine lineNumber="219"><span class="doxyHighlight">      Inner = 0x0,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00220" /><CodeLine lineNumber="220"><span class="doxyHighlight">      Header = 0x1,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00221" /><CodeLine lineNumber="221"><span class="doxyHighlight">      Exiting = 0x2,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00222" /><CodeLine lineNumber="222"><span class="doxyHighlight">    &#125;;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00223" /><CodeLine lineNumber="223"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Map of basic blocks to SCC IDs they belong to. If basic block doesn&#39;t</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00224" /><CodeLine lineNumber="224"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// belong to any SCC it is not in the map.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00225" /><CodeLine lineNumber="225"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">using </span><span class="doxyHighlight">SccMap = <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/densemap">DenseMap&lt;const BasicBlock &#42;, int&gt;</a>;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00226" /><CodeLine lineNumber="226"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Each basic block in SCC is attributed with one or several types from</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00227" /><CodeLine lineNumber="227"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// SccBlockType. Map value has uint32&#95;t type (instead of SccBlockType)</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00228" /><CodeLine lineNumber="228"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// since basic block may be for example &quot;Header&quot; and &quot;Exiting&quot; at the same</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00229" /><CodeLine lineNumber="229"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// time and we need to be able to keep more than one value from</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00230" /><CodeLine lineNumber="230"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// SccBlockType.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00231" /><CodeLine lineNumber="231"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">using </span><span class="doxyHighlight">SccBlockTypeMap = <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/densemap">DenseMap&lt;const BasicBlock &#42;, uint32&#95;t&gt;</a>;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00232" /><CodeLine lineNumber="232"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Vector containing classification of basic blocks for all  SCCs where i&#39;th</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00233" /><CodeLine lineNumber="233"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// vector element corresponds to SCC with ID equal to i.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00234" /><CodeLine lineNumber="234"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">using </span><span class="doxyHighlight">SccBlockTypeMaps = std::vector&lt;SccBlockTypeMap&gt;;</span></CodeLine>
